definition: to urge on (of horse)/to drive/to steer/to handle/to manage/to master/to dominate
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
variant of 御[yu4]/to drive/to manage/to control

sentences.english: Aggressive and timid driving behavior is what leads to stop-and-go traffic.
sentences.chinese: 胆大和胆小的驾驭行为导致了交通堵塞。

sentences.english: The State Department is simply not equipped to handle interdepartmental machinery.
sentences.chinese: 国务院根本不具备驾驭部际机构的能力。

sentences.english: One day as he was driving home from the market, he dropped his knife.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他驾驭着马车从家去赶集，他掉了他的刀。

sentences.english: If you can"t handle failure, then you can"t handle success either.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能驾驭失败，那你也无法驾驭成功。

sentences.english: If you can"t handle failure, then you can"t handle success either.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能驾驭失败，那你也无法驾驭成功。

sentences.english: It is a horse that reins well.
sentences.chinese: 那是一匹易于驾驭的马。

sentences.english: Tomorrow and yesterday are always equally far away, Carpe Diem.
sentences.chinese: 明天和昨天总是一样得远，驾驭今日。

sentences.english: Chinese people have surprising control ability to the architectural groups.
sentences.chinese: 中国人有着令人惊讶的对建筑群体的驾驭能力。

sentences.english: Maybe they steered the organizations a few degrees to the left or a few degrees to the right.
sentences.chinese: 他们驾驭着企业的大船或向右几度或向左几度。

sentences.english: It is now necessary to sharpen the market selection and tame ability of local government.
sentences.chinese: 当前须提高地方政府的市场选择及驾驭能力。

sentences.english: Believe in your ability to navigate the challenging terrains of romantic relationships.
sentences.chinese: 要相信自己能够驾驭充满挑战的爱情。

sentences.english: Is us, control the locomotive , drive the car case?
sentences.chinese: 是我们，驾驭了车头，带动着车箱？

sentences.english: Information, however, is notoriously difficult to manage.
sentences.chinese: 但众所周知的是，信息极难驾驭。

sentences.english: It isn’t difficult to create a strong thought wave and then ride it.
sentences.chinese: 要创造出一个强烈的思维并驾驭其上并不难。

sentences.english: Anyone dare say that such people are too immature to handle democracy?
sentences.chinese: 有谁敢说这样的人们驾驭起民主来太幼稚？

sentences.english: You can take your emotions one-way or another this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周可以自由驾驭自己的情绪。

definition: qualified/competent (professionally)/to be up to a task
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to pair up/to match/to arrange in pairs/to add sth into a group
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
(Tw) to wear selected items of clothing in combination to achieve a particular look/fashion styling
